channel.title: Suspiria (1977)
channel.description:
I don't think any of you know this, but I am a huge movie nerd!
and I just wanna talk about one of my favorite movies of all time: Suspiria.
The movie is basically about a young girl who enrolls in a ballet school and witnesses several murders, and she finds out that the school is a front for something far more sinister.
[b]If you are looking for an action packed modern hollywood thriller/horror this is probably not for you.[/b]
[b]If you can't appreciate scenery and you hate plots that take time to develop, this is probably not for you.[/b]
The movie was directed and written by one of my favorite directors: Dario Argento. I love all of his 70s/80s work. If you're a fan of Suspiria, you will love his other movies (especially Phenomena and Deep Red!).
I love this movie so much that I've taken the liberty of finding it for you guys :) I'd love to hear what you think, and if you like it as much as I do.
The plot doesn't really start to kick in until about the last 45 minutes, but the first half of the movie is [b]crucial[/b] if you want to understand what's going on.
AND THE SOUNDTRACK IS FUC[b][/b]KING KICK ASS THE MUSIC GOES PERFECT WITH EVERYTHING IT MAKES MY DI[b][/b]CK SO HARD
I'm going to be honest, I didn't appreciate as much as I do now until I watched it for the second time for some reason. It's just one of those movies.
Enough from me:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=onTYKt5lFNU[/youtube]
Like it? Hate it? Meh? Why? :)

item.title: Suspiria (1977)
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“DragonVyper, post:6, topic:538442”]This is my favorite Argento movie. Have you seen Deep Red, Opera, Tenebre, Inferno? If not: have a feeling you’d like them.

Horror buff here, too. In fact, it’s my profession.

Nice post![/quote]
omfg I’ve seen all of those except Opera! I really really liked Deep Red and Inferno. Tenebre was eh.

we need more people like you on mopar welcome to the community

Read full topic

item.title: Suspiria (1977)
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

KroniKz_:

The movie haha, why are you into old movies? I mean if you like the scenary and music that much then I guess its understandable but I just don’t like the acting/plot.

that’s a good question i really don’t even know

i guess the fims are much more ‘raw’ if that makes sense. no overdone special effects and cgi and all of that crap, just raw art

item.title: Suspiria (1977)
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:1, topic:538442”]I don’t think any of you know this, but I am a huge movie nerd!

and I just wanna talk about one of my favorite movies of all time: Suspiria.

The movie is basically about a young girl who enrolls in a ballet school and witnesses several murders, and she finds out that the school is a front for something far more sinister.

If you are looking for an action packed modern hollywood thriller/horror this is probably not for you.

If you can’t appreciate scenery and you hate plots that take time to develop, this is probably not for you.

The movie was directed and written by one of my favorite directors: Dario Argento. I love all of his 70s/80s work. If you’re a fan of Suspiria, you will love his other movies (especially Phenomena and Deep Red!).

I love this movie so much that I’ve taken the liberty of finding it for you guys I’d love to hear what you think, and if you like it as much as I do.

The plot doesn’t really start to kick in until about the last 45 minutes, but the first half of the movie is crucial if you want to understand what’s going on.

AND THE SOUNDTRACK IS FUCKING KICK ASS THE MUSIC GOES PERFECT WITH EVERYTHING IT MAKES MY DICK SO HARD

I’m going to be honest, I didn’t appreciate as much as I do now until I watched it for the second time for some reason. It’s just one of those movies.

Enough from me:

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=onTYKt5lFNU[/youtube]

Like it? Hate it? Meh? Why? :)[/quote]
not gonna lie this is very very creepy.

Read full topic
